text: how does one go about converting a standard {% module %} to a pre-built {% dnd_module %} without losing all of the edits users made in the CMS?

you’d have to manually set the info for each module to what the user has chosen. Take a look at the syntax in HS’s boilerplate
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/templates/pricing.html#L32>
right, but any fields the users filled out in the CMS for the same custom module - I can’t have those move over?
dnd_modules don't have IDs, so correct, you can't apply a DND template and expect page-level module edits to carry over, unfortunately
I mean, sure. that seems like a gigantic oversight, but I’ll take the wins when I get them I guess :pouting_cat:
Hi Steve, I understand your reasoning though I think this should provide a little bit of clarity. <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas#migration>
